summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The order establishes strict rules governing the handling, use, and disclosure of sensitive discovery materials produced by the government, including confidential witness/victim information and highly confidential sexualized images/videos.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which this protective order is issued. The order governs how she and her defense team can handle discovery materials.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this protective order.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case in which Maxwell is the defendant.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues a protective order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell to govern the handling of sensitive discovery materials.

keyFacts: The government's discovery materials include 'Highly Confidential Information' defined as containing 'nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images, videos, or other depictions of individuals.'
The protective order aims to protect the privacy of victims and witnesses, prevent prejudicial pretrial publicity, and safeguard the government's ongoing investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell is only allowed to review certain confidential discovery materials in the presence of her defense counsel or via a secure electronic system provided by the Bureau of Prisons.
The order strictly prohibits posting any discovery materials or information contained therein on the internet or social media.
The identity of any alleged victim or witness who has not publicly identified themselves on the record is to be treated as confidential information.
